title: Youth Climate Movement Organizes Largest Global Strike in History
introText: Young climate activists have organized the largest coordinated protest in history, with over 20 million people striking across 150 countries. The movement demands immediate government action on climate change.

content.content: Over 20 million students and supporters walked out of schools and workplaces worldwide, demanding emergency climate action. The strike exceeded previous records by 50%.
The youth climate movement has matured from school strikes to sophisticated political organizing. Young activists are running for office and building electoral coalitions around climate.
Polls show climate is now a top-three issue for voters under 35. Politicians are increasingly responsive to youth pressure, with several countries lowering voting ages to 16.
